titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّهُ يُسْتَحَبُّ لِلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يَكُونَ مُتَهَيِّئاً لِلْحَجِّ فِي كُلِّ وَقْتٍ
titles.en: Chapter 42 – It is recommended for the man that he happens to be prepared for the Hajj at all times

titles.ar: بَابُ الرَّجُلِ يُسْلِمُ فَيَحُجُّ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَخْتَتِنَ
titles.en: Chapter 43 – The man becomes a Muslim, so he performs Hajj before he is circumcised
Chapter 41 – The excess in the expenditure for the Hajj

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّهُ يُسْتَحَبُّ لِلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يَكُونَ مُتَهَيِّئاً لِلْحَجِّ فِي كُلِّ وَقْتٍ
titles.en: Chapter 42 – It is recommended for the man that he happens to be prepared for the Hajj at all times

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/171)
text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ زَعْلَانَ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ طَلْحَةَ عَنْ عِيسَى بْنِ أَبِي مَنْصُورٍ قَالَ قَالَ لِي جَعْفَرُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ ( عليه السلام ) يَا عِيسَى إِنِّي أُحِبُّ أَنْ يَرَاكَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فِيمَا بَيْنَ الْحَجِّ إِلَى الْحَجِّ وَ أَنْتَ تَتَهَيَّأُ لِلْحَجِّ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companins, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Al Hassan Za’lan, from Abdullah Bin Al Mugheira, from Hammad Bin Talha, from Isa Bin Abu Mansour who said,

‘Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> Bin Muhammad<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘O Isa! I<sup>asws</sup> would love it that Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic would See you, in what is between the Hajj to the Hajj, and you are prepared for the Hajj’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn al-Hassan Za’lan from ‘Abd Allah ibn al- Mughirah from Hammad ibn Talhah from ‘Isa ibn abu Mansur who has said the following: “Abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, once said to me , ‘O ‘Isa, I love that Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Glorious, see you in one al-Hajj to another al-Hajj and you are getting ready for another al-Hajj.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن أو موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/171)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حُسَيْنِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ وَ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ وَ غَيْرِهِمَا عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَمَّارٍ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مَنِ اتَّخَذَ مَحْمِلًا لِلْحَجِّ كَانَ كَمَنْ رَبَطَ فَرَساً فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Husayn Bin Usman, and Muhammad Bin Abu Hama, and someone else, from Is’haq Bin Ammar who said,
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The one who prepares the carriage for the Hajj is like the one who ties his horse in the Way of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Husayn ibn ‘Uthman and Muhammad ibn abu Hamzah and others besides the two from Ishaq ibn ‘Ammar who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘One who prepares a carriage (carried on camel back) for al-Hajj is like one who prepares a horse to be used in the way of Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Glorious.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/171)
text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ حَمْزَةَ بْنِ يَعْلَى عَنْ بَعْضِ الْكُوفِيِّينَ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ عَائِذٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ مَنْ رَجَعَ مِنْ مَكَّةَ وَ هُوَ يَنْوِي الْحَجَّ مِنْ قَابِلٍ زِيدَ فِي عُمُرِهِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Ahmad, from Hamza Bin Ya’la, from one of the Kufi’s, from Ahmad Bin Aiz, from Abdullah Bin Sinan who said,
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘The one who returns from Makkah, and he is intending the Hajj from the coming year, would have an increase in his life-span’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn Ahmad from Hamzah ibn Ya’liy from certain people of al-Kufa from Ahmad ibn ‘A’idh from ‘Abd Allah ibn Sinan who has said the following: “I once heard abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, say, ‘One who returns from Makkah with an intention to return to al-Hajj again in the future lives longer.’”
